name: National City
shortDescription: Diverse urban community south of downtown San Diego with historic charm and waterfront access.
fullDescription: National City offers affordable urban living with cultural diversity, the Mile of Cars auto district, and proximity to San Diego Bay. Residents enjoy quick freeway access to downtown and the Mexican border, along with revitalized neighborhoods and waterfront parks.
heroImageAlt: Marina and boats on San Diego Bay near National City

neighborhoods.name: San Diego
neighborhoods.description: Major metropolitan center to the north with employment hubs and cultural attractions.
neighborhoods.imageAlt: San Diego skyline viewed from the bay

neighborhoods.name: Chula Vista
neighborhoods.description: Neighboring city to the south with Otay Ranch Town Center and bayfront parks.

neighborhoods.name: Coronado
neighborhoods.description: Iconic island community with pristine beaches and historic Hotel del Coronado.

neighborhoods.name: Imperial Beach
neighborhoods.description: Southernmost beach city with laidback surf town vibe and pier.

highlights.title: Waterfront Living
highlights.description: Enjoy Pepper Park and National City Marina with bay views and recreational activities.

highlights.title: Cultural Diversity
highlights.description: Vibrant multicultural community with authentic international cuisine and festivals.
highlights.bgImageAlt: Evening street with string lights and diverse eateries

highlights.title: Mile of Cars
highlights.description: Legendary auto row with dealerships showcasing classic and new vehicles.
highlights.bgImageAlt: Auto row and commercial corridor at dusk

highlights.title: Urban Revitalization
highlights.description: Historic downtown revitalization with new housing, shops and public spaces.
highlights.bgImageAlt: Revitalized downtown street with shops and lights

faqs.question: What are the best neighborhoods in National City?
faqs.answer: Popular areas include the historic downtown, Paradise Hills, and bayfront communities near Pepper Park.

faqs.question: How is the real estate market in National City?
faqs.answer: More affordable than surrounding cities with a mix of historic homes and new developments, especially near the waterfront.

faqs.question: What is there to do in National City?
faqs.description: Visit the Mile of Cars, enjoy bayfront parks, explore multicultural dining, and attend events like the annual Christmas Parade.

faqs.question: How is commuting from National City?
faqs.answer: Excellent freeway access via I-5 and I-805, with trolley connections to downtown San Diego and the border.

acceptedAnswer.text: National City combines urban convenience with waterfront access and cultural diversity at more affordable prices than neighboring cities.
